abstract: Anders Behring Breivik, Norwegian extremist convicted of killing 77 people in 2011 bomb and gun attack, returns to court to pursue his claim that his solitary confinement violates his human rights; Breivik's case has strained tolerance and compassion of country committed to rehabilitating rather than penalizing criminals.

headline.print_headline: Killer in 2011 Norway Massacre Says Prison Conditions Violate His Rights
headline.main: Anders Behring Breivik, Killer in 2011 Norway Massacre, Says Prison Conditions Violate His Rights

snippet: Mr. Breivik, who killed 77 people in a gun and bomb rampage, claims that solitary confinement in a three-room prison suite amounts to torture.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Breivik, who killed 77 people in a gun and bomb rampage, claims that solitary confinement in a three-room prison suite amounts to torture.
